name: Dispensing of diesel, at pump
description: This process represents the transport of diesel from refinery to end-user pump. Data for transportation and distribution of diesel is sourced from R&D GREET 2024.

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data are from GREET published in 2024, but specific data for transportation and distribution are from FAF model in 2011.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Does not include Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands.
processDocumentation.completenessDescription: All data referring to refinery-to-pump fuel transportation methods are included. Data on emissions from dispensing are excluded.
processDocumentation.dataSelectionDescription: Data are sourced from the "T_D_Flowcharts" tab of GREET for U.S. Low Sulfur Diesel.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Note, because fuels can utilize different modes over multiple legs, shares of all modes, as indicated in the Parameters tab, can sum to over 100%.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
The transport data in GREET is based on the U.S. DOT Federal Highway Administrationâ€™s Freight Analysis Framework (FAF) model from 2011. That model is based on the 2007 Commodity Flow Survey (CFS), which captures data on shipments originating from certain business establishments located in the 50 states and DC. The CFS definition of a shipment is "a single movement of goods, commodities, or products from an establishment owned or operated by the same company as the originating establishment." Shipments that originate and terminate in a foregin location but pass through the US are not included. Imported products are accounted for at the point that they leave the importer's initial domestic location for shipment to another location. Shipments that pass through foreign countries are included as long as the shipment originates and terminates in the US. Mileage calculated for these shipments exclude the international segment. 

Shipment data was collected through a mailout/mailback questionnaire where establishments were asked to provide shipment information about a sample of individual outbound shipments during a specified week in each calendar quarter. The distance traveled by each freight shipment sampled for the 2007 CFS was estimated using routing algorithms and an integrated, intermodal transportation network created specifically for this purpose.

sources.name: Argonne National Laboratory (2013) Update to Transportation Parameters

processDocumentation.intendedApplication: This process is applicable for modelling the fuel input into mobile equipment.
processDocumentation.projectDescription: This process has been updated by the FLCAC Data Curator.

dataDocumentor.name: Franklin Associates, A Division of ERG
